climbs.name: Whoopsie Daisy
climbs.fa: Adam Grant, Jason Whitcomb, Austin White

content.description: Watch for the packrat that lives in the crack.  He's been friendly so far.
content.location: Look for the obvious left leaning crack.  The first bolt can be clipped from the ground to protect the opening moves.

content.description: This route is like two completely different climbs stacked on top of each other. The bottom is steep with big moves and is pumpy. The top is beta specific with delicate moves. The crux of the bottom is probably around the 3rd bolt as the crux of the top is probably around the last bolt.
content.location: As you head up the gully Vidalia starts directly right of the big tree on a ledge. The climb starts by standing on a  bolder and goes straight up the steep face.

content.description: Short.  Awkward clip at the 3rd bolt and tough to clip chains.
content.location: Scramble up and into the large V slot uphill from the 1st sport climb.

content.description: Bolts, with a few pieces of chain and a pin.  Chain Anchors.  Bring
content.location: After walking past the graffiti covered face, you'll step down into the gully proper.  Look for the bolts on the West facing wall.

content.description: This Climb has a little bit of everything. From jams, slopers, Crimps, slots and ring locks to heel hooks, and high steps. While simultaneously testing your mental fortitude. Sweet Pea starts at the base of a ramp for the first few bolts then goes straight up and over a roof. After the roof the climbing gets less steep but isn't over until the anchor.  (I have only done this with a 70 Meter rope I don't know if a 60 Meter will work)
content.location: This climb is up the gully from Whoopsie Daisy about 100'. Sweet Pea starts at the base of a ramp and shares the belay area with Apple Num Num.

content.description: The obvious open book.  Good gear, with an option for a #5 or #6 if you need it.  The climb has no defined finish or anchors.  One could walk off to the East, or there are some random pins and bolts that can be rapped off to the West (bring webbing, since it often gets removed).
content.protection: Standard rack, wide gear optional, no anchors
content.location: Look north when walking over the toe of the buttress, near where it touches the road.  It's the obvious open book

climbs.name: Dirt Nap
climbs.fa: Jason Whitcomb, Ben Jackson, Adam Grant

content.description: Contrived lower section leads to a steep headwall finish.
content.location: About 20 feet uphill from "Sweet Pea".  Approach the first bolt from the left.  It can be clipped before climbing to protect the belayer from being pulled off the belay stance in case of an early fall.

content.description: This is a fun, steep sport climb that stays fairly sustained. The Crux is near the middle of the climb around the 5th bolt. Good feet with okay hands and some balance will get you through this part.
content.location: This climb is up the gully from Whoopsie Daisy About 100'. The belay area is directly below a ramp. Apple Num Num is the climb on the right that goes straight up. Sweet Pea is the climb on the left that goes up the ramp.
